hints.content:
We know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD{10}$ students in poetry club.

And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

Each students wrote $\purpleC2$ poems.

The product will tell us the $\greenD{\text{total}}$.

In this problem, the $\greenD{\text{total}}$ is the $\greenD{\text{total number of poems written by the whole club}}$.
The product tells us the $\greenD{\text{total number of poems written by the whole club}}$.

question.content:
There are $10$ students in the poetry club. This week, each student wrote $2$ poems. 

**What does the expression $10\times2$ represent?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: Total number of poems written by the whole club
Total number of poems each student wrote
